meanings.definition: An economic system in which private individuals own the means of production and operate for profit.
meanings.sent1: In capitalism, individuals own businesses to make money.
meanings.sent2: Capitalism allows people to start their own companies and earn profits.
meanings.sent3: The party was a capitalism-themed event where guests traded homemade goods for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for capitalism was like a fire burning bright, driving her to create new businesses.
meanings.sent5: The concept of capitalism can be compared to a game where players strive to earn the most money.

meanings.definition: The accumulation of wealth and resources for investment in order to generate profit.
meanings.sent1: His success in capitalism led to the growth of his savings and investments.
meanings.sent2: Capitalism involves saving money to make more money in the future.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's capitalism of collecting nuts for winter storage was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The idea of capitalism as a money-making machine fueled his ambition to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The image of capitalism as a tree growing money leaves a lasting impression on young minds.

meanings.definition: The belief in the importance of private ownership and free market competition.
meanings.sent1: Her strong belief in capitalism motivated her to support small businesses.
meanings.sent2: Capitalism values competition and individual ownership of property.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's capitalism of claiming its own iceberg made the other animals chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The essence of capitalism as a race to success inspired many entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to explain capitalism to her students, making it easy to understand.
